content.name: ethernetPort
content.description: Information about Ethernet ports in the storage system.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the Ethernet port instance.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: Health information for the Ethernet port, as defined by the health resource type.

attributes.name: storageProcessor
attributes.description: SP on which the Ethernet port directly or indirectly resides, as defined by the storageProcessor resource type.

attributes.name: needsReplacement
attributes.description: Indicates whether the Ethernet port needs replacement. Values are: \u003Cul> \u003Cli>true - Ethernet port needs replacement.\u003C/li> \u003Cli>false - Ethernet port does not need replacement.\u003C/li> \u003C/ul>

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: User-specified Ethernet port name.

attributes.name: portNumber
attributes.description: Physical Ethernet port sequence number.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description: Current link speed of the Ethernet port.

attributes.name: mtu
attributes.description: Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) packet size that the Ethernet port can transmit. The default is 1500 bytes per packet.

attributes.name: connectorType
attributes.description: Physical connector type.

attributes.name: bond
attributes.description: Indicates whether the Ethernet port is used in a link aggregation. Values are: \u003Cul> \u003Cli>true - Ethernet port is used in a link aggregation.\u003C/li> \u003Cli>false - Ethernet port is not used in a link aggregation.\u003C/li> \u003C/ul>

attributes.name: isLinkUp
attributes.description: Indicates whether the Ethernet port has link. (Applies if the Ethernet port is configured with a link.) Indicates whether the Ethernet port's link is up. Values are: \u003Cul> \u003Cli>true - Link is up.\u003C/li> \u003Cli>false - Link is down.\u003C/li> \u003Cul>

attributes.name: macAddress
attributes.description: MAC address of the Ethernet port.

attributes.name: isRSSCapable
attributes.description: Indicates whether the Ethernet port supports Receive Side Scaling (RSS). Values are: \u003Cul> \u003Cli>true - Ethernet port supports RSS.\u003C/li> \u003Cli>false - Ethernet port does not support RSS.\u003C/li> \u003C/ul>

attributes.name: isRDMACapable
attributes.description: Indicates whether the Ethernet port supports Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA). Values are: \u003Cul> \u003Cli>true - Ethernet port supports RDMA.\u003C/li> \u003Cli>false - Ethernet port does not support RDMA.\u003C/li> \u003C/ul>

attributes.name: requestedSpeed
attributes.description: Link speed requested by the user.

attributes.name: parentIOModule
attributes.description: (Applies if the Ethernet port resides on an I/O module.) Parent I/O module of the Ethernet port, as defined by the ioModule resource type.

attributes.name: parentStorageProcessor
attributes.description: (Applies if the Ethernet port resides directly on an SP.) Parent SP of the Ethernet port, as defined by the storageProcessor resource type.

attributes.name: supportedSpeeds
attributes.description: Available speed values.

attributes.name: requestedMtu
attributes.description: MTU size requested by the user.

attributes.name: supportedMtus
attributes.description: Available MTU sizes.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: Resource type and identifier of the Ethernet port's parent enclosure, as defined by the resourceRef resource type.

attributes.name: sfpSupportedSpeeds
attributes.description: SFP (the small form-factor pluggable) supported speeds of the Ethernet port.

attributes.name: sfpSupportedProtocols
attributes.description: SFP (the small form-factor pluggable) supported protocols of the Ethernet port.

actions.description: Recommend Ethernet ports to use for link aggregation.

arguments.name: ethernetPort
arguments.description: Ethernet port for which to recommend other ports for link aggregation.

arguments.name: recommendedPorts
arguments.description: Recommended ports, in order of preference.

actions.description: Modify the Ethernet port's Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) size.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the Ethernet port to modify.

arguments.name: mtuSize
arguments.description: MTU packet size that the Ethernet port can transmit, in bytes.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Requested data transmission speed for the Ethernet port.
